Generation III.Ruby: Inside Shelgon 's armor-like shell, cells are in the midst of transformation to create an entirely new body. This Pok é mon 's shell is extremely heavy, making its movements sluggish.
Generation III.Sapphire: Covering Shelgon 's body are outgrowths much like bones. The shell is very hard and bounces off enemy attacks. When awaiting evolution, this Pok é mon hides away in a cavern.
Generation III.Emerald: It hardly eats while it awaits evolution. It becomes hardier by enduring hunger. Its shell peels off the instant it begins to evolve.
Generation III.FireRed: Its armored body makes all attacks bounce off. The armor is too tough, however, making it heavy and somewhat sluggish.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Its armored body makes all attacks bounce off. The armor is too tough, however, making it heavy and somewhat sluggish.

Generation IV.Diamond: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.
Generation IV.Pearl: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.
Generation IV.Platinum: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It surrounds its body in an iron-hard shell to accumulate enough power to evolve.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It surrounds its body in an iron-hard shell to accumulate enough power to evolve.

Generation VI.X: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.
Generation VI.Y: Its armored body makes all attacks bounce off. The armor is too tough, however, making it heavy and somewhat sluggish.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Inside Shelgon's armor-like shell, cells are in the midst of transformation to create an entirely new body. This Pokémon's shell is extremely heavy, making its movements sluggish.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Covering Shelgon's body are outgrowths much like bones. The shell is very hard and bounces off enemy attacks. When awaiting evolution, this Pokémon hides away in a cavern.

Generation VII.Sun: The cells within its shell transform with explosive speed, preparing it for evolution.
Generation VII.Moon: They lurk deep within caves—motionless, neither eating nor drinking. Why they don't die is not known.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: The cells within its body are changing at a bewildering pace. Its hard shell is made from the same substance as bone.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Shelgon lives deep within caves. It stays shut up in its hard shell, dreaming of the day it will be able to fly.

Generation VIII.Sword: This Pokémon has covered its body in a hard shell that has the same composition as bone. Shelgon stores energy for evolution.
Generation VIII.Shield: Shelgon ignores its hunger entirely, never eating any food. Apparently, Shelgon will evolve once all its energy stores are used up.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant the Pokémon evolves.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant the Pokémon evolves.

Generation IX.Scarlet: The cells within its shell transform with explosive speed, preparing it for evolution.
Generation IX.Violet: Its armored body makes all attacks bounce off. The armor is too tough, however, making it heavy and somewhat sluggish.

Generation IV.SoulSilver: Safari Zone (tall grass in Wetland with 63 Peak points)
